Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no clinical trial for a potential COVID-19 vaccine currently taking place in Senegal.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of children who died after receiving the vaccine, as there is no evidence to support this.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no clinical trial or evidence to confirm the deaths of children after receiving the vaccine.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that mass vaccination for COVID-19 in Senegal started on April 8, which is not supported by any evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the video used to support the claim was manipulated and did not actually show children dying after receiving the vaccine.
